Do not suffer the little children for the Kingdom of Heaven belongs to them.  That’s what Jesus said so any other action is contrary to the Bible.

In the King James Version, Jesus says "Suffer (allow) the little children ... to come unto Me." It's a different but related meaning of "suffer", and it is not the children but the listeners who are to do it.

,https://www.,biblegateway.com/verse/en/Matth,ew%2019:14, ,…
Yes, I know. And He tells His listeners that the Kingdom of Heaven belongs to such as these.  My tweet gave the meaning of Jesus words broke into 240 characters.

Jesus' words (as reported in the KJV) are not "Do not suffer the little children..." but "Suffer (allow) the little children..." You are right about the meaning, wrong about the words. Go and look in your bible. (Not that I set any store by it, but accuracy is a good thing.)

And as I explained, I was giving the meaning and not the exact words which is why I did not cite book, chapter and verse.  I’m struggling with the fact that you seem to be arguing about something we agree on.
